BERT sentiment analysis class.

convert_data_to_examples(train, valid, TEXT_COL, SENTIMENT_COL)[source]

Convert train and valid data into InputExample format.

Parameters:

  • train (pd.DataFrame) – train dataframe

  • valid (pd.DataFrame) – valid dataframe

  • TEXT_COL (str) – text column name in train and valid

  • SENTIMENT_COL (str) – sentiment column name in train and valid

Returns:

InputExample of all rows in train validation_InputExamples: InputExample of all rows in valid

Return type:

train_InputExamples

convert_examples_to_tf_dataset(examples, tokenizer, max_length=50)[source]

Convert InputExample into tensorflow dataset.

Parameters:

  • examples (list) – list of InputExample

  • tokenizer (BertTokenizer) – BERT tokenizer

  • max_length (int, optional) – max_length of text encoding.

  • 50. (Default is) –

Returns:

tensorflow dataset

Parameters:

Returns:

Return type:

predict(test)[source]

Predict BERT model on test data.

Parameters:

test (pd.DataFrame) – test dataframe

Returns:

predicted sentiment labels for test dataset probs: probabilities of the predicted sentiment labels tf_predictions: probabilities of both labels 0 and 1 for test dataset

src.models.sentiment_analysis.train.train module

This module contains sentiment_analysis_train function.

src.models.sentiment_analysis.train.train.sentiment_analysis_train()[source]

Train sentiment analysis models on training data.

Processed dataset will be split into 80% train and 20% valid. BERT, Logistic Regression, and LSTM models will be fitted on training data and evaluated on validation data. All 3 models and metrics, and BERT training graph will be saved to storage.
